fields.title: The Pilgrim Mother
fields.content:
The Pilgrim Mothers are a five-piece musical collective from the South Coast of England, where the waves crash and the seabirds fly. 

We make vintage, rootsy, folky, soulful sounds and play brand new original songs about life, love and longing - as well as eclectic covers including songs by Tom Waits, Van Morrison, vintage gospel, blues and wartime tunes. Celebrating the past, singing for a better now.
fields.excerpt: Tickets £5, all events are pre-booked in bubbles

fields.title: Owen Donovan
fields.content: Popular local singer-guitarist Owen brings his unique style to rock, soul and pop classics!

fields.title: Olioke
fields.content:
Our new regular Thursday
Karaoke night we is continuing on with an acoustic theme...
Go to www.olioke.uk
to see what songs we have
available... Bring a mic... or a hairbrush...
to sing into as (due to COVID)
we can't share mics!
fields.excerpt: Free

fields.title: Con Brio
fields.content: Classic jazz and blues standards from this accomplished quintet. John has been known to spring surprise guests on us, and it always a grand night of cool vibes!

fields.title: Joel White
fields.content:
Come and join Joel White for a fantastic night of music at our next Covid safe performance.

‘Joel performs a fantastic range of funk, soul and blues and his playing is first class. Definitely a gig not to be missed’
Doors open at 8pm, performance at 8.30pm.
fields.excerpt: Tickets £5, all events are pre-booked in bubbles

fields.title: Troubadours!  Naomi Bedford and Paul Simmonds
fields.content:
Troubadours! our monthly roots and acoustic night in the Playhouse!  Tickets £8 

Naomi Bedford and Paul Simmonds are a duo, based in the folk and country roots genre.
They have made 4 acclaimed albums and been nominated for a Radio 2 Folk Award ( Best Original Song). They tour widely and have appeared at Cambridge Festival, Glastonbury, Celtic Connections and many others. Their last album (2019)  ‘Singing It All Back Home’, an album of Appalachian Ballads, originating in England and Scotland, was featured as the Guardian Album of the Month. Playing songs from the same album they were also featured in session on the Mark Radcliffe  BBC Radio 2 show. 

Paul is also the chief songwriter with legendary folk rock band The Men They Couldn’t Hang; his songs have featured in films, TV, radio and in academic resources. 
Naomi has co written and sung on ‘Funny Break’, a Top 20 hit with Orbital and has appeared on Later with Jools Holland.

"Amazing, Naomi pulls no punches" Iggy Pop
"Naomi is the best singer of Appalachian ballads that I know" Shirley Collins
Folk Album of the month - The Guardian June 2019

Supported by Tim Hoyte

fields.title: Playtime at Printers Playhouse
fields.content:
An adventure through space... a new planet every week... 

Join our interactive, immersive storytelling experience!

Let our professional storytelling performers whisk you away to awesome new planets every week...

...becoming intergalactic explorers flying through the stars...

...meet weird and wonderful inhabitants while traversing strange and astonishing new landscapes...

...watch the space opera unfold then become part of the story through imaginative improvisation and role play!

3-6 Yrs 10.15 – 11am
7-11 Yrs 11.30 – 12.30pm

Mixed age families can attend together

On Saturdays ending July 31st
fields.excerpt: Tickets £8, discount for block bookings

image.filename: Copy of Copy of Copy of Playtime at Printers Poster(3).png

fields.title: 'Eastbourne Pride after Party' with Rick Bonner
fields.content:
PPH is the place to be after the towns celebration of inclusivity and diversity. 

Come and grab a Rainbow drink and party the night away with the fabulous Rick Bonner.

Rick has a new album out, and we are proud to feature original songs from this hugely popular local musician!

Ticket MUST be booked in advance. Limited tickets £5 per person in social distance compliant ‘table bubbles’.

Please email info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to ‘book your bubble’.

RICK performs some of the greatest songs ever written and recorded by the greatest performers that ever lived.

RICK is also an outstanding Jazz SAXOPHONE, and CLARINET PLAYER.
fields.excerpt: Tickets £5, all events are pre-booked in bubbles

fields.title: Open Stage
fields.content:
The best open mic in Eastbourne. 

Free entry and first act from 8pm.

Musicians, poets, storytellers, comedians are all welcome! Basically anyone who needs a mic to express their art.
fields.excerpt: Ticket MUST be booked in advance. £10 holding deposits for tables.

fields.title: Quiz
fields.content:
Our wildly successful Quiz in the Dark as moved to a permanent spot inside on a Sunday night...

...Join us for a quiz like no other, now hosted inside our beautiful venue by our very own bar manager Ross the 'Ginja Ninja' Smith. 

Drinks, laughs and prizes to be won.
fields.excerpt: £2 per person to play, max 6 per team. Ticket MUST be booked in advance.

fields.title: Holding Space
fields.content:
If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents. 

Relaxed group offering a safe, confidential space; time to chat, connect and share with one another. Know that you are not alone as a parent.
fields.excerpt: Holding Space is a free Monthly group starting Thursdays 10am-11.30am

fields.title: Beginners Chair Yoga
fields.content:
Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation.

Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed.
fields.excerpt: Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur May 20th 10.30am-11.30am

fields.title: 3am Feast
fields.content:
In the early hours a 22-year-old man sits in silence at his local kebab shop. Whether it’s the 10 pints he’s just sunk or the strong smell of doner meat, something is turning his stomach. Join him as he tries to put the pieces of his life together, and fix the world’s problems one chip at a time.

Corey Hennelly invites you to his local kebab shop for one night only, where you will join him as he tries to save the world. The world does need a hero right now, and all Corey has to offer is a 5* Uber rating. He’s going to need your help.

Basically Theatre presents 3am Feast

Written and Performed by Corey Hennelly

Directed by Laura Singleton

Running time: 50-60 mins
fields.excerpt: Tickets £14, concessions available

fields.title: Props Club
fields.content:
Make a window into a hidden world with art tutor and theatre designer 
Lucy Dean. 

Theatrical scenes in a closed box,  viewed through a peephole.
theatrical self expression in a box!
fields.excerpt:
Hidden Worlds - 6 Weeks £60 total/£10 a session
Starting Wednesday May 19th 2pm-3.30pm

fields.title: Happenings
fields.content:
In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it?

If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.
fields.excerpt: Printers at the Grove, a new play by John Berry

fields.title: The Golgis
fields.content:
Defying all attempts at categorisation, this fine doodah band lifts the spirits and gladdens hearts!

“The South East's Premier Absurdist Pantomime Acoustic Theatre Art Alternative Folk Rock Band. Attempting to build on the huge success of their hit single 'It's Still a Hoover' (number 173 in the Billingshurst chart), The Golgis have now discovered even more instruments they are unable to play properly"
fields.excerpt: Tickets £5, all events are pre-booked in bubbles

fields.title: Jazz Groove Collective
fields.content: Perennial favourite Paul Watson brings his quartet of groove-masters for a welcome return to Printers!  Expect top quality funk and soul and you will not be disappointed!

fields.title: Danny Goring
fields.content: Talented Hastings based singer-songwriter returns to Printers Playhouse for a fine evening of original music and his own interpretation of folk and roots songs from other artists!

fields.title: The Great Fire
fields.content:
The Great Fire bring their eclectic, electric playlist to Printers Playhouse. The 4-piece band from Eastbourne will be playing feel-good covers from more than 5 decades of Pop, Rock, Funk and Blues.

Visit www.thegreatfire.co.uk to find out more
fields.excerpt: Tickets £5, all events are pre-booked in bubbles

fields.title: AK Patterson in Concert!
fields.content:
Exciting new talent AK Patterson finishes her UK summer tour at Printers 
Playhouse!   
She has been dubbed ‘a woman possessed’, and at the heart of each performance 
is her unique vocal style. Brought up in a jazz-centric household, with influences 
ranging from Bjork, Jeff Buckley, Ella Fitzgerald to Portuguese Fado musicians, she 
is also an accomplished guitar and fiddle player.  She and her bandmates, Alfie 
Weedon (double bass and vcls) and Nat Reading (multi-instrumental), build a rich 
musical world and met whilst playing the Brighton music circuit and festival scene 
in 2015. Having spent three years growing a following in Brighton and London and 
supporting alt-J in 2018 for the Brits week, the band are on the eve of releasing 
their first single Shadows, produced by Charlie Andrew. ​
​
This is a Revive Live Tour event, sponsored by Music Venues Trust and the National 
Lottery.   
One attendee in the double ticket should have a Lottery ticket for entry please!
fields.excerpt: Tickets £9 a double

fields.title: Eastbourne Filmmakers Evening
fields.content:
Come join Eastbourne’s filmmaking circle as we celebrate local and neighbouring shorts - from zero budgets upwards. Everyone is welcome to share or just come along to watch and chat to the creators afterwards.

A chance for filmmakers in the Eastbourne, Brighton and Hastings area to come together and share their shorts, trailers, and have a drink and a chat. And if you're not a filmmaker, come along and support your local filmmakers - watch their stuff and give 'em some feedback!
fields.excerpt: Free

fields.title: The Lost Trades + Tomorrow Bird
fields.content:
Printers Playhouse is delighted to present a double bill of new music featuring Folk/Americana artists The Lost Trades and Tomorrow Bird. The Lost Trades are a trio of Wiltshire based singer songwriters (Jamie R Hawkins, Phil Cooper and Tamsin Quin) who, brought together by a mutual love of folk and roots music, have joined forces for a three part harmony, modern folk adventure. 
Tomorrow Bird is a British acoustic duo comprising of solo artist Jen Bird and Simon Driscoll from the folk- rock band, Burnt Tomorrow. Drawing influences from bands such as The Civil Wars, their haunting melodies and heart-felt lyrics have transfixed audiences and marked them out as a band to watch! The concert starts at 7.30 pm.  Tickets £5

fields.content:
All abilities welcome to experiment with collage and make art in a supportive environment. 

Join Sarah in using found and made collage materials to explore creative expression.

fields.title: Rise & Rhyme
fields.content:
So pleased to finally be able to host this fantastic spoken word event!
We fully sold out the original event, so hope to see everyone who already has a ticket... let us know if you can make it...
We will be joined by our headliner Shell Huggett performing with Jakob. We also have MC G-Funk, spoken word poets -M.Jumbo, Pixie, J.Berry, Rambling Rose, G.Jones and story-teller Hazel plus many more more..!!!
fields.excerpt: Free

fields.title: Zachary Dogwood
fields.content: Soulful rock originals with an edge from Adam and the band.  Always a big night at Printers and and album in the making!

fields.title: Coffee Morning
fields.content: Coffee and catch up for over 50’s – a chance to enjoy a cuppa and a catch up.
fields.excerpt: Coffee Group is free and will meet monthly on Wednesdays.

fields.title: Book Club
fields.content:
Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book! 

Come along to the first session to discuss what books we enjoy and what we would to read. Books will be chosen by consensus. 

We are currently reading 'The Carer' By Deborah Moggach.
fields.excerpt: PPH Book Club  is a monthly free group meeting Wednesdays 10.30 - 11.30

fields.title: The Great Fire
fields.content:
The Great Fire bring their eclectic, electric playlist to Printers Playhouse. 

The 4-piece band from Eastbourne will be playing feel-good covers from more than 5 decades of Pop, Rock, Funk and Blues.

With support from Deano and the Danglers

fields.excerpt: SOLD OUT

fields.title: Red Green and Blue
fields.content:
Red, Green and Blue: an acoustic duo whose dynamic performances feature beautiful vocal harmonies.....

Brian McDonald and Megan Ramsey are Kent based acoustic duo "Red Green and Blue", their dynamic performances feature beautiful vocal harmonies original music and lyrics. "The magic that seems to happen when Brian's voice and mine combine is one of the great joys of performing with him."
fields.excerpt: Tickets £5, all events are pre-booked in bubbles
